title: Syriac Gospels, British Library, Add. 14454
text:
British Library, Add MS 14454, designated by number 87 on the list of <a href="William%20Aldis%20Wright">Wright</a>, is a <a href="Syriac%20language">Syriac</a> <a href="manuscript">manuscript</a> of the <a href="New%20Testament">New Testament</a>, according to the <a href="Peshitta">Peshitta</a> version, on parchment. <a href="Palaeography">Palaeographically</a> it has been assigned to the 6th or 7th century.
Description.
It contains the text of the first three <a href="Gospel">Gospel</a>s according to Peshitta version, on 131 leaves (10¼ by 9⅛ inches), with some <a href="Lacuna%20%28manuscripts%29">lacunae</a>. The number of quires is now 14. The writing is in two columns per page, 22-27 lines per page. The writing is in fine and regular <a href="Estrangela">Estrangela</a>.
The text is divided according to the <a href="Ammonian%20Sections">Ammonian Sections</a>, with references to the <a href="Eusebian%20Canons">Eusebian Canons</a>. There is a harmony of the four Gospels at the foot of each page.
There are two notes on folio 1 recto.
The manuscript was brought from the <a href="covenant%20of%20St.%20Mary%20Deipara">covenant of St. Mary Deipara</a>. It was described by <a href="William%20Aldis%20Wright">William Aldis Wright</a>.
The manuscript is housed at the <a href="British%20Library">British Library</a> (Add MS 14454) in <a href="London">London</a>.
